Preliminary ESP regressions Abigail Tyrell 13 Apr 2021 Acadian redfish Stock region: Gulf of Maine / Georges Bank EPU: GB, All, all, NE

1 Introduction These are preliminary regressions that compare Gulf of Maine / Georges Bank Acadian redfish catch, abundance, recruitment, and F to various indicators in the GB, All, all, NE Environmental Protection Units (EPUs) taken from the ecodata package. The indicators are lagged by 0 years.

2 Regression analysis All regressions are simple linear correlations assessed at the p < 0.5 level. Please note, due to the large number of indicators tested, a certain amount of statistically significant results are expected even if there are no underlying mechanistic connections. These correlations do not necessarily imply causation.

3.1 Abundance 3.1.1 Generalized linear model This is an exploratory fit of a poisson GLM. Initial covariates were included based on statistical significance at a Bonferroni-corrected alpha in the linear correlations shown in this report. Final covariates were chosen by forward stepwise AIC selection of additive GLMs. rnames Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|) (Intercept) 108 4.82 22.3 1.45e-110 ANNUAL_CHLOR_A_RATIO_ANOMALY_ 11.2 0.0428 262 0 cumulative_intensity_degrees_C 0.00187 1.4e-05 134 0 Longitude_degreesW -7.79 0.202 -38.6 0 along_shelf_distance_km 0.192 0.00358 53.7 0 fall_OI_SST_Anomaly_degreesC -0.124 0.00328 -37.7 0 Latitude_degreesN -20 0.31 -64.7 0 GLORYS_bottom_temp_anomaly_ 0.662 0.00378 175 0 Warm_Core_Rings_n 0.0303 0.000207 146 0 ANNUAL_CHLOR_A_MEDIAN_mg_m__3 -4.8 0.04 -120 0 ANNUAL_PPD_RATIO_ANOMALY_ -3.49 0.0381 -91.6 0 summer_OI_SST_Anomaly_degreesC 0.0241 0.00254 9.51 1.87e-21 Dropped coefficients: none
